snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s recent announcement of 29,000 possible seats for prekindergarten has run into rules that are different for 4-year-olds.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column details how New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's plan to put more than 21,000 4-year-olds into prekindergarten classes has run into difficulties, specifically about conforming to rules about how much space young students require; contends the logistics are so formidable that de Blasio is likely to focus more on less affluent neighborhoods than on actually providing universal prekindergarten.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s recent announcement of 29,000 possible seats for prekindergarten has run into rules that are different for 4-year-olds.

headline.main: No Easy Task in Bid to Find Seats for Pre-K
headline.print_headline: No Easy Task in Bid to Find Seats for Pre-K
